list_definition.definition: a compartment in which the pilot of an aeroplane/airplane, driver of a racing car etc sits

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The pilot climbed into the cockpit.

list_ex_of_english: Not many years ago, these territories were cockpits of conflict and dissent.
Open cockpits were retained, although later modifications were planned for passenger compartments in the interior.
The pilot and observer/gunner sat close together in separate open cockpits, with the pilot directly under the upper wings.
There are two tandem open cockpits, one below the wing trailing edge and the other below mid-chord.
The aircraft were fitted with a completely new, high-lift wing, and one of the cockpits was replaced by a chemical hopper.
The pilot and instructor sat in tandem, open cockpits.
The article analyzes transcriptions of pilots interacting in the cockpit on actual scheduled passenger flights.
There was usable space inside the fuselage between the cockpits, enough to carry three passengers or two stretcher cases.
